title: Let's go to Nan
text:
NEWSPAPER SECTION: LIFE | WRITER: PICHAYA SVASTI - + Until the end of this month, the Tourism Authority of Thailand's Phrae Office, which oversees tourism marketing in Phrae, Nan and Uttaradit, invites tourists to experience various aspects of Nan province through 10 creative activities. 
Phra That Chae Haeng, Nan. 
Details are provided in pamphlets available at the Muang Nan Municipality Tourism Centre and 10 participating attractions: Wat Phra That Chae Haeng, Sootrit Art Gallery, Rim Nan Art Gallery, Hong Chao Fong Kham, Wat Phra Kerd, Ban Sri Na Pan-Ta Waen Eco-tourism Centre, Doi Silver Factory, Nong Bua Village of Thai Lue, Phu Fah Pattana Centre and Doi Phu Kha National Park. 
To join this campaign, interested persons can click Like on the Tat Phrae Facebook fan page, or visit and join the learning activities featured in the brochures, take pictures with the "Like: Tat Phrae" sign or the "Stay in Nan for a Long Time" sign and write down what they feel and share on the Facebook fan page. All participants will receive glasses baring the image of a local couple, called Grandpa and Grandma, from the TAT local office. Call the Muang Nan Municipality Tourism Centre on 054-751-169 or the TAT's Phrae Office on 054-521-127. Siam tulips in Suphan Buri 
Throughout this month, the Agricultural Occupation Promotion and Development Centre in U Thong district, Suphan Buri province, is celebrating National Mother's Day on Aug 12, at its Siam tulip plantation. 
Several strains of Siam tulip, or krajiao , are in full bloom this time of the year. Apart from enjoying the beauty of Siam tulips and posing for pictures in the centre's big field, visitors can buy various kinds of flowers and plants and local goods, watch farming exhibitions and enjoy delicious food. Admission is free. Visit www.tatsuphan.net or call the centre on 035-437-705 or 089-837-3277. Golf Festival in the South 
Golfers are welcome to enjoy special prices at 10 leading golf courses in Cha-am district, Phetchaburi, and Hua Hin district, Prachuap Khiri Khan, during the "14th Hua Hin/Cha-am Golf Festival 2015" from now until Sept 30. 
The green fee is only 1,000 baht per round at the Kaeng Krachan Country Club, The Imperial Lake View Hotel & Golf Club, the Royal Thai Army Sport Centre, Suanson Pradipat Golf Course, The Majestic Creek Golf & Resort, Palm Hills Golf Club & Residence, Springfield Royal Country Club, Royal Hua Hin Golf Course and The Eagle Milford Golf Club, and 1,800 baht per head per round at the Banyan Golf Club, Hua Hin, and Black Mountain. 
In addition, fees for competitions held on Sundays in August and September are 1,600 or 2,400 baht per head, per competition at each of the participating golf courses. Call the TAT Phetchaburi Office on 032-471-005/6 or the TAT Prachuap Khiri Khan Office on 032-513-885. Shirt painting contest 
On Saturdays and Sundays until Aug 16, the TAT Samut Songkhram Office, which oversees tourism marketing in Samut Songkhram, Samut Sakhon and Nakhon Pathom, in collaboration with Ta Khiak Ta Khai Sabai Cheewa Shirt Painting Shop will host a shirt painting contest. 
Those interested can receive free shirts from the TAT local office and paint them under the "Must-see City: Samut Songkhram â€” the City of Waterways" concept, take pictures with them and post them on the TAT Samut Songkhram fan page. The person who obtains the most number of Likes will receive an award from the TAT. Results will be announced on Aug 21. Visit www.facebook.com/TATSamutSongkhram for more information.
